Posts.Content: Hi, I know what you mean with reference this decision as I only asked this question to my surgeon last friday. I had a invasive duct 2cm tumour which was graded 2/3 Her2, however with chemo that has now shrunk to 8mm and I still have one chemo to go. I am due to have a lumpectomy then rads the first week in March however I am starting to look to the future and wondered it mastectomy would be a better option. My surgeon was pretty firm with me and said that the survival rate for mastectomy and lumpectomy with rads is exactly the same and mastectomy wasnt really an option.... It has played on my mind since then though. I have been advised though on the Breast Cancer Care forum that the main difference is that lumpectomy has a 10% higher recurrence rate to that of mastectomy. I am however going along with my surgeon as I do have faith in him and he has all the facts. I dont have any family history of breast cancer so will do everything I can once the treatment has finished to try and keep this horrible disease at bay and for it never to rear its ugly head again.... I wish you well and that you have come to a decision. Linda x
